definition: to dive down fast/to swoop down
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

sentences.english: You control pitch and roll with the accelerometer.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通过重力感应控制飞机俯冲和爬升。
那只鹰收拢双翅做俯冲。

sentences.english: The thirty - six Enterprise dive-bomber were being squandered in a jittery shot from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 这三十六架“企业号”上的俯冲轰炸机正被孤注一掷。

sentences.english: The subducted slabs was metamorphosed to water-bearing eclogite before being melted.
sentences.chinese: 该俯冲板片熔融前通常变质为含水的榴辉岩。

sentences.english: The south Tianshan ocean polarity of subduction is south to north.
sentences.chinese: 而且中天山南缘洋盆俯冲极性应向北。

sentences.english: If you can't see the bottom, jump in, don't dive.
sentences.chinese: 如果水深不见底，跳进去时脚先落水，不要俯冲下水。

sentences.english: It was the most perfidious and dangerous dive bomber the Germans had.
sentences.chinese: 这是德国人拥有的最出色而危险的俯冲轰炸机。
他又一次俯冲下去进行轰炸。

sentences.english: Then one swoop, one swing of the arm.
sentences.chinese: 然后一次俯冲，一次振臂。

sentences.english: BANSHEE RIDERS circle and swoop, darkening the sky above the grotto.
sentences.chinese: 骑着斑溪兽的战士在天空盘旋俯冲，遮天蔽日。

sentences.english: The eagle swooped down and caught a fish in its talons .
sentences.chinese: 鹰俯冲下来然后用爪子捕获了一条鱼。

sentences.english: The blueschist was formed owing to intercontinental subduction.
sentences.chinese: 那里的蓝片岩是由于陆内俯冲而形成。

sentences.english: He flew and used his left wing to hit Kira.
sentences.chinese: 俯冲并用左翼攻击吉良。

sentences.english: In a subduction earthquake, parts of the fault zone are uplifted, while others dip down.
sentences.chinese: 俯冲地震中，部分断裂层上升，其他部分则下沉。

sentences.english: He dived his plane straight at the enemy tanks.
sentences.chinese: 他使飞机直接对准敌坦克俯冲。

sentences.english: At last, the forming mechanism of A-type subduction is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 最后，作者对“A”型俯冲的形成机理进行了探讨。

definition: to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
be high up in the sky
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
to rise/to ascend/to climb (airplane etc)/to go up (sales figures etc)/to gain promotion
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
to catapult/to launch/to eject (from a plane)/to shoot
